creditline: Lent by Dr. James E. Standefer
text: The Chinese Taoist immortal Tekkai (<I>T'ieh-kuai<I>) had the unusual ability to exhale his soul from his body, thus allowing it to freely travel great distances. Once when Tekkai's soul had been gone for several days, his young disciple assumed that the immortal had abandoned his mortal body, so he cremated it. When Tekkai's soul finally returned, it had no place to reside and had to settle for the dead body of a lame beggar. Hence, as can be seen in the small sculpture, Tekkai (literally "iron crutch") wears the beggar's tattered clothes and uses his crutch. Here, the artist shows Tekkai with inflated cheeks, as if ready to exhale his soul.
title: (The Immortal Tekkai)
